shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 1r-154v) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 1r-120v) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 120v-132v) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 132vb-138ar) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 138ava-149va) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 149vb-154vb)
Additio 1.

txstates.txstate: The sewing has been crudely repaired with a recent synthetic thread. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 88, 99, 104, 106, 114.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

inks.ink: Black, red (strong red, vivid vermillion from fol. 71r onwards)

txfolios.txfolio: The leaf following fol. 138 has been numbered 138a.

squires.squire: [፩]I(10/fols. 1r-10v) – ፪II(10/fols. 11r-20v) – ፫III(10/fols. 21r-30v) – ፬IV(10/fols. 31r-40v) – ፭V(10/fols. 41r-50v) – ፮VI(10/fols. 51r-60v) – [፯]VII(10/fols. 61r-70v) – ፰VIII(10/fols. 71r-80v) – [፱]IX(10/fols. 81r-90v) – [፲]X(10/fols. 91r-100v) – [፲፩]XI(10/fols. 101r-110v) – [፲፪]XII(10/fols. 111r-120v) – [፲፫]XIII(10/fols. 121r-130v) – [፲፬]XIV(10/fols. 131r-139v) – [፲፭]XV(10/fols. 140r-149v) – [፲፮]XVI(6/fols. 150r-155v).

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 2r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for fol. 139r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1D1D/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; incipits and numbers of Songs; title of Texts I-2, I-3 and I-5; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስብሕዎ in Ps. 150 (here 151); letters ባ and ክ of the word ይባርክዎ and letters ቡ and ኒ in the word ስቡሕኒ in Canticle 10; letters እ, ዚ, ብ and ር in the word እግዚአብሔር on fol. 138a; abbreviations of refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5; a few single letters or words in Texts I-4, I-5, I-6; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
A few groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-4, and on fol. 139r.

abbreviations.abbreviation: እስ᎓ for እስመ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ ምሕረቱ᎓ (Ps. 135, fols. 110v-111r) ስ᎓ for ስቡሕኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fols. 128v-130v) Text I-4 ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ፤ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠ፡/ሠረ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 138va-139rb) እ᎓/እስ፡/እስመ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 139va-141ra) ኵ፡/ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 141rb-143ra) ና፡/ናዓ፡/ናዓብ: for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 143va-145va) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fol. 145vb) ተ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 147va-148rb) ወ፡/ወበ፡/ወበእንተዝ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 148va-149va) Text I-5 ወ፤ ሣ፤ ይ፤ ሰ፤ ቅ፤for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Word or its abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. በ፡/በእ፡/በእንተዝ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 150rb-154rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Pss. 20, 26, 87 and 118 are not numbered. - The following Pss. are numbered incorrectly: 10 (numbered 11), 21 (20), 27 (28), 37 (38), 47 (48), 58 (57), 64 (63), 65 (64), 77 (76), 78 (77), 86 (85), 95 (94), 149 (150), 150 (151), 151 (152). - Ps. 145 has two titles: its own and the same title as Ps. 144.

additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in a poor hand. It has been erased from fol. 155r where presumably the details of the transaction were written.

extras.extra: - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten by a chain of nine-dot asterisks linked by two parallel lines or by means of a chain of red and black dots. - Indications concerning the special occasions when certain Pss. could be read, e.g., በንስሐ፡ ጊዜ: are written, in pen, on fols.: 3v, 4v, 5v, 7v, 8r, 13v, 14v, 16r, 18v, 20r, 21r, 22v, 25r. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the whole line or the end of the line: e.g., fols. 5v, 19r, 45r, 69r, 91r, 111v, 130r. - Part of the line is taken up: e.g., fols. 8v, 21v, 44r, 76v, 116v, 134r. - Part of the line is taken down: e.g., fols. 15r, 23r, 75v, 101v, 105r, 137r. - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of a of two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions written in the upper margin, in secondary hands, belong: fols. 35r l.3, 45v l.7, 49v l. 21, 60v l. 17, 61v l. 21. - Omitted letters, words and passages are written interlineally, in the main hand: e.g., fols. 30v, 36v, 122v, 149r. - A correction is crudely written next to the erased word: fol. 56v. - Scribbles: e.g., fols. 1r-2r, 3v, 38v, 39v-42r, 43r, 44r-45r, 58r, 59v, 63v, 78v, 82v, 99r-105r, 112r, 124r, 125r, 137r, 152v, 155v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks are written in the upper left corner of the first fol. of the quire: fols. 11r, 21r, 31r, 41r, 51r, 71r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily reading of Text I-1 is indicated by the name of the day of the week written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand: - ዘረቡዕ: fol. 46v.

frames.frame: Fol. 1r (incipit of Text I-1): elaborate, coloured (red, green) ornamental band; floral and geometric motifs. Fol. 76v: elaborate, coloured (various shades of red) ornamental band; floral and geometric motifs, interlaces. Fol. 95r: elaborate, coloured (strong vermillion, black, deep rose) ornamental band; floral motifs, interlaces. Fol. 114v: elaborate, coloured (strong vermillion, deep rose, white) ornamental band; floral motifs, interlaces. Fol. 138av (incipit of Text I-4): elaborate, coloured (strong vermillion, deep rose, white) ornamental band; floral motifs, interlaces.
